sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词都有"死"之意。
means: dead ： 指已停止呼吸和心脏跳动，与alive(活着的，活的)相对。
dying ： 指奄奄一息，行将死亡。

sentence.Network_en: She spent a period of time working with people dying of cancer.
sentence.Network_cn: 她有一段时间曾帮助垂危的癌症患者。

sentence.Network_en: But that doesn't mean this brand of politics is dead or dying.
sentence.Network_cn: 但那并不意味着这种政治主张已经或正在消亡。

sentence.Network_en: Persons dying from cancer grow thin and visibly waste away.
sentence.Network_cn: 因患癌症濒临死亡的人会日渐消瘦，而且身体明显衰弱。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 涉死期中，病人只是垂死（dying）而并未死亡，亦即尚未发生脑死亡。2、将临床死亡的标志简单地概括为心跳，呼吸完全停止和反 …

jx.jx_en_mean: for the rest of one's life

lj.lj_ly: I shall remember that to my dying day.
lj.lj_ls: 我将在有生之年都记着它。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: present participle of die

entry.def: Dying is the present participle of die .
A dying person or animal is very ill and likely to die soon.
You use dying to describe something which happens at the time when someone dies, or is connected with that time.

example.ex: It'll stay in my mind till my dying day...
example.tran: 它将长存我心，直到生命的终点。

example.ex: She was compelled to fulfil the dying wishes of her mother.
example.tran: 她不得不去实现她母亲的临终遗愿。

entry.tran: 行将结束的;最后时刻的;末期的
entry.def: The dying days or dying minutes of a state of affairs or an activity are its last days or minutes.

example.ex: The islands were seized by the Soviet army in the dying days of the second world war...
example.tran: 这些岛屿是在二战末期被苏联军队占领的。

example.ex: A penalty by Thierry Lacroix broke the deadlock in the dying minutes of the game.
example.tran: 蒂里·拉克鲁瓦的点球在比赛结束前的最后时刻打破了僵局。

entry.def: A dying tradition or industry is becoming less important and is likely to disappear completely.
A dying fire is no longer hot and bright and will not burn for much longer.

sentences.sentence: "it was the death of all his plans"

means.word_mean: 1. in or associated with the process of passing from life or ceasing to be;

sentences.sentence: "anxious to see the new show at the museum"

auth_sentence.content: Dying at home Many choose to die at home.
auth_sentence.res_content: Dying at home Many choose to die at home.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Dying at home Many choose to die at home.

auth_sentence.content: She was screaming to me that she was dying.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was screaming to me that she was dying.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was screaming to me that she was dying.

auth_sentence.content: These thinks can end up in some one dying .
auth_sentence.res_content: These thinks can end up in some one dying .
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These thinks can end up in some one dying .

Sentence.sentence: The effect was first noted in 1858 by William Farr, who wrote that widows and widowers (鳏夫) were at a much higher risk of dying than their married peers.
That's the sound of a dying forest.
trees that are dying usually give out a soft moan

sentences.en: A man should study till his dying day.
She’s heard so much about you. She’s dying to meet you.
sentences.cn: 她总是听人说起你，非常想见你。

sentences.en: We’re all dying of curiosity—come on, tell us what happened!
sentences.cn: 我们都快好奇死了，快点告诉我们发生了什么事！

sentences.en: I swear I won’t forgive her to my dying day!
sentences.cn: 我发誓我有生之年都不会原谅她！
